title: 114_s3245
content: The Act may be cited as the "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" and supports clinical nurse specialists. The Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016 supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include authorized clinical nurse specialist programs that provide education for registered nurses to effectively care for patients with acute and chronic illness. The Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016 supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include authorized clinical nurse specialist programs that educate nurses to provide care for patients with acute and chronic illness. Additionally, the Act defines a nurse-managed health clinic as a primary care or wellness service managed by advanced practice nurses for underserved populations. The National Advisory Council on Nurse Education and Practice amended the Public Health Service Act to include clinical nurse specialists in addition to nurse anesthetists. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs. The Public Health Service Act is amended to update various sections related to loan repayment, scholarship programs, nurse faculty loans, and geriatric education funding. Additionally, Section 831 is amended to include grants for nurse education, practice, quality, and retention. Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act is amended to include grants for nurse education, practice, quality, and retention. This includes promoting career advancement for nursing personnel in various training settings and diverse population groups. The Public Health Service Act is amended to include grants for nurse education, practice, quality, and retention. This involves promoting career advancement for nursing personnel through internships, residency programs, and collaboration with accredited schools of nursing. The Public Health Service Act is amended to include grants for nurse education, practice, quality, and retention, promoting career advancement for nursing personnel through internships, residency programs, and collaboration with accredited schools of nursing. Subsection (g) is amended to include nurse-managed health clinics. Subsection (h) is removed.
